title: PLAZA ORB / spirit bomb ready
description: A thought orb to pop up just before the Mercenary Tribunal

dialogueTree.title: Inland Empire: "Stop. Just up ahead: danger."
dialogueTree.polish: Stój. Coś jest przed tobą. Niebezpieczeństwo.

links.title: Inland Empire: "You are prepared. Don't put away yo..."
links.english: You are prepared. Don't put away your friend. Your weapon. It is glowing in your hand, ready to serve.
links.polish: Jesteś gotowy. Nie chowaj swojego przyjaciela – swojej broni. Błyszczy ci w dłoni, gotowy, by służyć.
links.belarusian: Ты гатовы. Не хавай свайго сябра – сваёй зброі. Ззяе ў тваёй руцэ, гатовы, каб служыць.

links.title: Composure: "Raindrops slip down the oily fabric..."
links.english: Raindrops slip down the oily fabric of the tail end of your necktie-turned-fuse.
links.polish: Krople deszczu spływają po tłustym materiale końcówki lontu, niegdyś twojego krawata.
links.belarusian: Кроплі дажджу стікаюць па тлустым матэрыяле канца фітылю, некалі твайго гальштука.

links.title: You: ""Kim, there's danger. Up ahead.""
links.english: "Kim, there's danger. Up ahead."
links.polish: „Kim, niebezpieczeństwo. Przed nami”.
links.belarusian: «Кім, небяспека. Наперадзе нас».

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes. I hear commotion..." He cups..."
links.english: "Yes. I hear commotion..." He cups his ear. "Let's go."
links.polish: „Tak. Słyszę jakiś zgiełk...” – odpowiada, przykładając dłoń do ucha. „Ruszajmy”.
links.belarusian: «Так. Я чую нейкі шум...» — адказвае, прыкладаючы руку да вуха. «Пайшлі».

links.title: You: "I'm ready to do this."
links.english: I'm ready to do this.
links.polish: Jestem gotowy.
links.belarusian: Я гатовы.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Good. Be ready to take damage."
links.english: Good. Be ready to take damage.
links.polish: Świetnie. Bądź gotów na rozwałkę.
links.belarusian: Выдатна. Будзь гатовы да разбуральнага дзеяння.

links.title: You: "I'll feel prepared as soon as I swi..."
links.english: I'll feel prepared as soon as I switch out my real police gun.
links.polish: Będę gotowy, jak tylko wyciągnę swoją prawdziwą, policyjną broń.
links.belarusian: Я буду гатовы, як толькі дастану сваю сапраўдную, паліцэйскую зброю.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Do what you need to do. And then ke..."
links.english: Do what you need to do. And then keep moving toward the future.
links.polish: Zrób, co masz do zrobienia. A potem ruszaj dalej ku przyszłości.
links.belarusian: Зрабі тое, што трэба зрабіць. А потым рухайся далей у будучыню.

links.title: You: "I'm scared..."
links.english: I'm scared...
links.polish: Boję się...
links.belarusian: Баюся...

links.title: Inland Empire: "This isn't the time for fear. Go."
links.english: This isn't the time for fear. Go.
links.polish: To nie jest pora na strach. Ruszaj.
links.belarusian: Гэта не час для страху. Ідзі.

links.title: Composure: "Snow gathers on the oily fabric of..."
links.english: Snow gathers on the oily fabric of the tail end of your necktie-turned-fuse.
links.polish: Śnieg zbiera się na tłustym materiale końcówki lontu, niegdyś twojego krawata.
links.belarusian: Снег збіраецца на тоўстым матэрыяле канца кнота, калісьці твайго гальштука.

links.title: Composure: "The oily tail end of your necktie-t..."
links.english: The oily tail end of your necktie-turned-fuse glistens in the cool spring light.
links.polish: Tłusta końcówka lontu, niegdyś twojego krawata, połyskuje w zimnym wiosennym świetle.
links.belarusian: Тлусты канец фітіля, калісьці вашага гальштука, блішчыць у халодным веснавым святле.

dialogueTree.title: Inland Empire: "Stop. Just up ahead: danger."
dialogueTree.polish: Stój. Coś jest przed tobą. Niebezpieczeństwo.

links.title: Hand/Eye Coordination: "You are prepared. Don't put away yo..."
links.english: You are prepared. Don't put away your friend. Your weapon.
links.polish: Jesteś gotowy. Nie chowaj swojej przyjaciółki – broni.
links.belarusian: Ты гатовы. Не хавай сваёй сяброўкі – зброі.

links.title: Interfacing: "Raindrops slip from the barrels of..."
links.english: Raindrops slip from the barrels of your Villiers 9mm pistol.
links.polish: Krople deszczu ześlizgują się z luf twojego pistoletu Villiers kal. 9 mm.
links.belarusian: Кроплі дажджу слізгаюцца з дула вашага пісталета Villiers кал. 9 мм.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Wait -- your old friend has prepare..."
links.english: Wait -- your old friend has prepared you for this -- at great cost to himself. Make sure you have the spirit bomb in your hand when *shit goes south*.
links.polish: Poczekaj. Twój stary przyjaciel przygotował cię na to, płacąc ogromną osobistą cenę. Pamiętaj, żeby mieć w ręce bombę spirytusową, kiedy już *wszystko się zesra*.
links.belarusian: Пачакай. Твой стары сябра падрыхтаваў цябе да гэтага, заплаціўшы велізарную асабістую цану. Памятай, каб мець у руцэ спіртовую бомбу, калі ўжо *усё пойдзе наперкасяк*.

links.title: Hand/Eye Coordination: "For God's sake -- find some bullets..."
links.english: For God's sake -- find some bullets before you go any further. An unloaded gun won't do you any good!
links.polish: Na boga, znajdź jakąś amunicję, zanim tam pójdziesz. Niezaładowana broń na nic ci się nie przyda!
links.belarusian: Калі ласка, знайдзіце нейкія боепрыпасы, перш чым ісці туды. Незагружаная зброя не прынясе вам карысці!

links.title: Interfacing: "Snowflakes speck the barrels of you..."
links.english: Snowflakes speck the barrels of your Villiers 9mm pistol.
links.polish: Płatki śniegu znaczą lufy twojego pistoletu Villiers kal. 9 mm.
links.belarusian: Сняжынкі абазначаюць стволы вашага пісталета Villiers калібра 9 мм.

links.title: Interfacing: "The barrels of your Villiers 9mm pi..."
links.english: The barrels of your Villiers 9mm pistol shine threateningly in the cold spring light.
links.polish: Lufy twojego pistoletu Villiers kal. 9 mm połyskują złowrogo w zimnym wiosennym świetle.
links.belarusian: Стволы вашага пісталета Villiers кал. 9 мм злавесна блішчаць у халодным веснавым святле.

dialogueTree.title: Inland Empire: "Stop. Just up ahead: danger."
dialogueTree.polish: Stój. Coś jest przed tobą. Niebezpieczeństwo.
dialogueTree.belarusian: Стаій. Нешта ёсць перад табой. Небяспека.

links.title: Hand/Eye Coordination: "You are prepared. Don't put away yo..."
links.english: You are prepared. Don't put away your friend. Your weapon.
links.polish: Jesteś gotowy. Nie chowaj swojej przyjaciółki – broni.
links.belarusian: Ты гатовы. Не хавай сваю сяброўку – зброю.

links.title: Interfacing: "Raindrops slip from the barrels of..."
links.english: Raindrops slip from the barrels of your Nachtwey A80 pistol.
links.polish: Krople deszczu ześlizgują się z luf twojego pistoletu Nachtwey A80.
links.belarusian: Кроплі дажджу слізгаюцца з дула вашага пісталета Nachtwey A80.

links.title: Authority: "Why don't you take out your trusty..."
links.english: Why don't you take out your trusty Villiers instead?
links.polish: Czemu nie wyciągniesz zamiast tego swojego zaufanego Villiersa?
links.belarusian: Чаму ты замест гэтага не дасташ свайго надзейнага Вільерса?

links.title: Logic: "There really isn't much of a differ..."
links.english: There really isn't much of a difference between these two guns...
links.polish: Między tymi spluwami nie ma aż takiej różnicy...
links.belarusian: Між гэтымі стрэльбамі няма такой вялікай розніцы...

links.title: Authority: "What?! You can't compare the sidear..."
links.english: What?! You can't compare the sidearm issued to you personally by the RCM to the pistol of a known criminal?
links.polish: Co?! Nie porównujesz chyba broni przydzielonej ci przez MOR do pistoletu znanej przestępczyni?
links.belarusian: Што?! Ты, напэўна, не параўноўваеш зброю, якая табе была прызначана РГМ, з пісталетам знакамітай злачынцы?

links.title: Inland Empire: "Wait -- your old friend has prepare..."
links.english: Wait -- your old friend has prepared you for this -- at great cost to himself. Make sure you have the spirit bomb in your hand when *shit goes south*.
links.polish: Poczekaj. Twój stary przyjaciel przygotował cię na to, płacąc ogromną osobistą cenę. Pamiętaj, żeby mieć w ręce bombę spirytusową, kiedy już *wszystko się zesra*.
links.belarusian: Пачакай. Твой стары сябра падрыхтаваў цябе да гэтага, заплаціўшы велізарную асабістую цану. Памятай, каб мець у руцэ спіртовую бомбу, калі ўжо *ўсё сапсуецца*.

links.title: Hand/Eye Coordination: "For God's sake -- find some bullets..."
links.english: For God's sake -- find some bullets before you go any further. An unloaded gun won't do you any good!
links.polish: Na boga, znajdź jakąś amunicję, zanim tam pójdziesz. Niezaładowana broń na nic ci się nie przyda!
links.belarusian: На бога, знайдзі нейкі боезапас, перш чым туды ісці. Незараджаная зброя табе нікчаму не дапаможа!

links.title: Interfacing: "Snowflakes speck the barrels of you..."
links.english: Snowflakes speck the barrels of your Nachtwey A80 pistol.
links.polish: Płatki śniegu znaczą lufy twojego pistoletu Nachtwey A80.
links.belarusian: Сняжынкі адзначаюць ствалы вашага пісталета Nachtwey A80.

links.title: Interfacing: "The barrels of your Nachtwey A80 pi..."
links.english: The barrels of your Nachtwey A80 pistol shine threateningly in the cold spring light.
links.polish: Lufy twojego pistoletu Nachtwey A80 połyskują złowrogo w zimnym wiosennym świetle.
links.belarusian: Ствольная коробка вашай дзевяткі Nachtwey A80 змрочна бліскае ў халодным веснавым святле.

dialogueTree.title: Inland Empire: "Stop. Just up ahead: danger."
dialogueTree.polish: Stój. Coś jest przed tobą. Niebezpieczeństwo.

links.title: Hand/Eye Coordination: "What you have isn't enough. You'll..."
links.english: What you have isn't enough. You'll need more firepower. A ranged weapon.
links.polish: To, co masz, nie wystarczy. Potrzebujesz większej siły ognia. Broni dystansowej.
links.belarusian: Тое, што ў цябе ёсць, недастаткова. Табе неабходна больш моцная агнявая сіла. Дыстанцыйная зброя.

links.title: Interfacing: "Water streams down your Kvalsund KR..."
links.english: Water streams down your Kvalsund KR+2 Multi-Tool. It looks impressive -- but what can it do against military-grade weaponry?
links.polish: Woda spływa po twoim kvalsundzkim multitoolu KR+2. Wygląda imponująco, lecz czy zdziała coś w starciu z bronią wojskową?
links.belarusian: Вада сцякае па тваім квальсундскім мультыінструменце KR+2. Ён выглядае ўражліва, але ці дасягне чагосьці ў сутыкненні з ваеннай зброяй?

links.title: You: ""I'm not sure I feel ready for what..."
links.english: "I'm not sure I feel ready for what lies ahead."
links.polish: „Nie wiem, czy czuję się gotowy na to, co nas czeka”.
links.belarusian: «Не ведаю, ці адчуваю я сябе гатовым да таго, што нас чакае».

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Then you'd better get ready." He f..."
links.english: "Then you'd better get ready." He frowns, then quickly adds, "Whatever happens, I've got your back."
links.polish: „Więc lepiej się przygotuj” – stwierdza, marszcząc czoło, po czym szybko dodaje: „Cokolwiek się stanie, możesz na mnie liczyć”.
links.belarusian: «Таму лепш падрыхтуйся», — кажа ён, хмурачыся, а затым хутка дадае: «Што б ні здарылася, можаш на мяне разлічваць».

links.title: You: "I prefer hand-to-hand combat."
links.english: I prefer hand-to-hand combat.
links.polish: Wolę walkę wręcz.
links.belarusian: Я аддаю перавагу рукапашны бой.

Alternate1.english: "I prefer hand-to-hand combat. It's more honourable."
Alternate1.belarusian: «Аддаю перавагу рукапашнаму бою. Гэта больш ганарова».

links.title: Inland Empire: "This is not the time to discuss pre..."
links.english: This is not the time to discuss preferences. It's not just your own life that will be at stake.
links.polish: To nie czas na dyskusje o osobistych preferencjach. Stawką nie jest tu tylko twoje życie.
links.belarusian: Гэта не час для абмеркавання асабістых пераваг. Тут на коне не толькі тваё жыццё.

Alternate1.english: And you think you're off to die an honourable death? What about the lives of the people depending on you?
Alternate1.polish: I myślisz, że po prostu idziesz umrzeć sobie honorową śmiercią? A co z życiem ludzi, którzy na tobie polegają?
Alternate1.belarusian: І ты думаеш, што проста пойдзеш памерці сабе гонарнай смерцю? А што з жыццём людзей, якія на цябе разлічваюць?

links.title: You: "I'll fight with my bare hands if I..."
links.english: I'll fight with my bare hands if I have to.
links.polish: Jeśli będę musiał, stoczę tę walkę gołymi rękami.
links.belarusian: Калі трэба будзе, я змагу ваяваць голымі рукамі.

links.title: Inland Empire: "It would be better if you didn't ha..."
links.english: It would be better if you didn't have to. It's not just your own life that will be at stake.
links.polish: Lepiej by było, gdybyś nie musiał. Stawką nie jest tu tylko twoje życie.
links.belarusian: Лепш было б, каб табе не давялося. На коне не толькі тваё жыццё.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "Water streams down your prybar. Or..."
links.english: Water streams down your prybar. Or crowbar. Or prybar. Call it what you will -- it doesn't stand a chance against military-grade weaponry.
links.polish: Woda spływa po twoim łomie. Czy też breszce. Albo łomie. Nazywaj to, jak chcesz. Tak czy inaczej, nie ma szans z bronią wojskową.
links.belarusian: Вада сцякае па тваім ломці. Ці берасце. Або ломці. Называй гэта, як хочаш. Так ці інакш, няма шанцаў супраць ваеннай зброі.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Statistically speaking, sabres have..."
links.english: Statistically speaking, sabres have proven to be rather ineffective against  military technology.
links.polish: Statystycznie rzecz ujmując, szable są raczej nieskuteczne w starciu z technologią wojskową.
links.belarusian: Зыходзячы са статыстыкі, шаблі з'яўляюцца даволі неэфектыўнымі ў сутычцы з ваеннай тэхналогіяй.

links.title: Interfacing: "Snowflakes stick to your Kvalsund K..."
links.english: Snowflakes stick to your Kvalsund KR+2 Multi-Tool. It looks impressive -- but what can it do against military-grade weaponry?
links.polish: Płatki śniegu przyklejają się do twojego kvalsundzkiego multitoola KR+2. Wygląda imponująco, lecz czy zdziała coś w starciu z bronią wojskową?
links.belarusian: Сняжынкі прыліпаюць да твайго квалсундскага мультатула KR+2. Выглядае ўражліва, але ці зможа нешта зрабіць у сутыкненні з ваеннай зброяй?

links.title: Physical Instrument: "Snowflakes stick to your prybar. Or..."
links.english: Snowflakes stick to your prybar. Or crowbar. Or prybar. Call it what you will -- it doesn't stand a chance against military-grade weaponry.
links.polish: Płatki śniegu przyklejają się do twojego łomu. Czy też breszki. Albo łomu. Nazywaj to, jak chcesz. Tak czy inaczej, nie ma szans z bronią wojskową.
links.belarusian: Сняжынкі прыляпляюцца да твайго ломіка. Ці брусочка. Альбо ломіка. Называй гэта, як хочаш. У любым выпадку, шанцаў няма супраць ваеннай зброі.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Statistically speaking, sabres have..."
links.english: Statistically speaking, sabres have proven to be rather ineffective against advanced military technology.
links.polish: Statystycznie rzecz ujmując, szable są raczej nieskuteczne w starciu z zaawansowaną technologią wojskową.
links.belarusian: Статыстычна кажучы, шаблі хутчэй неэфектыўныя ў параўнанні з сучаснымі ваеннымі тэхналогіямі.

links.title: Interfacing: "Your Kvalsund KR+2 Multi-Tool looks..."
links.english: Your Kvalsund KR+2 Multi-Tool looks impressive, shining in the cold spring light -- but what can it do against military-grade weaponry?
links.polish: Twój kvalsundzki multitool KR+2 wygląda imponująco, kiedy połyskuje w zimnym wiosennym świetle, lecz czy zdziała coś w starciu z bronią wojskową?
links.belarusian: Твой квасундскі мультытул KR+2 выглядае ўражліва, калі ззяе ў халодным вясновым святле, але ці зможа што-небудзь зрабіць у сутычцы з ваеннай зброяй?

links.title: Physical Instrument: "You try to take comfort in the weig..."
links.english: You try to take comfort in the weight of your prybar. Or crowbar. Or prybar. Call it what you will -- it doesn't stand a chance against military-grade weaponry.
links.polish: Próbujesz odnaleźć pocieszenie w ciężarze swojego łomu. Czy też breszki. Albo łomu. Nazywaj to, jak chcesz. Tak czy inaczej, nie ma szans z bronią wojskową.
links.belarusian: Ты спрабуеш знайсці суцяшэнне ў цяжару сваёй ломай. Ці ж ломіка. Альбо лома. Назаві гэта, як хочаш. Так ці інакш, ніякіх шансаў супраць ваеннай зброі.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Statistically speaking, sabres have..."
links.english: Statistically speaking, sabres have proven to be rather ineffective against advanced military technology.
links.polish: Statystycznie rzecz ujmując, szable są raczej nieskuteczne w starciu z zaawansowaną technologią wojskową.
links.belarusian: Статыстычна кажучы, шаблі даволі неэфектыўныя ў супрацьстаянні з перадавымі ваеннымі тэхналогіямі.

dialogueTree.title: Inland Empire: "Stop. Now. It is time."

links.title: You: "For what?"
links.english: For what?
links.polish: Na co?
links.belarusian: На што?

links.title: Inland Empire: "Crisis, death. You can feel it in y..."
links.english: Crisis, death. You can feel it in your blue soul.
links.polish: Na kryzys. Na śmierć. Czujesz to w swojej smętnej duszy.
links.belarusian: На крызіс. На смерць. Адчуваеш гэта ў сваёй змрочнай душы.

links.title: You: "What am I supposed to do?"
links.english: What am I supposed to do?
links.polish: I co ja mam zrobić?
links.belarusian: І што мне рабіць?

links.title: Inland Empire: "Your old friend has prepared you fo..."
links.english: Your old friend has prepared you for this -- at great cost to himself. Make sure you have the spirit bomb in your hand when *shit goes south*.
links.polish: Twój stary przyjaciel przygotował cię na to, płacąc ogromną osobistą cenę. Pamiętaj, żeby mieć w ręce bombę spirytusową, kiedy już *wszystko się zesra*.
links.belarusian: Твой стары сябра падрыхтаваў цябе да гэтага, заплаціўшы велізарную асабістую цану. Памятай, каб мець у руцэ спіртавы кактэйль, калі ўжо *ўсё пойдзе наперакасяк*.

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "You hear what sounds like an enthus..."
links.english: You hear what sounds like an enthusiastic gurgling coming from the spirit bomb in your pocket.
links.polish: Bomba spirytusowa w twojej kieszeni wydaje z siebie odgłos przypominający entuzjastyczne gulgotanie.
links.belarusian: Спіртная бомба ў тваёй кішэні выдае гук, які нагадвае энтузіязмам буркатанне.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "You know what you should do? Take o..."
links.english: You know what you should do? Take out the spirit bomb...
links.polish: Wiesz, co powinieneś zrobić? Wyciągnąć bombę spirytusową...
links.belarusian: Ведаеш, што табе трэба зрабіць? Дастаць спиртовую бомбу...

links.title: Inland Empire: "Shush. He's not drinking the spirit..."
links.english: Shush. He's not drinking the spirit bomb. He's putting it in his hand and he's going to be ready.
links.polish: Ćśś. Nie będzie pił bomby spirytusowej. Weźmie ją do ręki i będzie gotowy.
links.belarusian: Цс-с. Не будзе піць спіртную бомбу. Возьме яе ў рукі і будзе гатовы.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Be prepared. Make sure you have you..."
links.english: Be prepared. Make sure you have your pepperbox in your hand.
links.polish: Przygotuj się. Upewnij, że masz w garści swoją spluwę.
links.belarusian: Падрыхтуйся. Пераканайся, што трымаеш у руцэ сваю зброю.

links.title: Interfacing: "Your fingers reflexively reach for..."
links.english: Your fingers reflexively reach for the Villiers 9mm pistol in your pocket.
links.polish: Twoje palce instynktownie sięgają po pistolet Villiers 9 mm w twojej kieszeni.
links.belarusian: Твае пальцы інстынктыўна цягнуцца да пісталета Villiers 9 мм у тваёй кішэні.

links.title: Hand/Eye Coordination: "For God's sake -- find some bullets..."
links.english: For God's sake -- find some bullets before you go any further. An unloaded gun won't do you any good!
links.polish: Na boga, znajdź jakąś amunicję, zanim tam pójdziesz. Niezaładowana broń na nic ci się nie przyda!
links.belarusian: На Бога, знайдзі нейкі боепрыпас, перш чым ісьці туды. Ня загружаная зброя табе нічым не дапаможа!

links.title: Inland Empire: "Be prepared. Wield Ruby's double-ba..."
links.english: Be prepared. Wield Ruby's double-barrelled pistol.
links.polish: Przygotuj się. Wyciągnij dwulufowy pistolet Ruby.
links.belarusian: Падрыхтуйся. Дастань двухствольны пісталет Ruby.

links.title: Authority: "What a shitty gun. But it's better..."
links.english: What a shitty gun. But it's better than nothing.
links.polish: Co za gówniana broń. Ale lepsze to niż nic.
links.belarusian: Што за дрэнь зброя. Але лепш гэта, чым нічога.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Arm yourself with anything you can...."
links.english: Arm yourself with anything you can. Unless you have... nothing? Because you didn't find your lost gun? Then just walk to your death.
links.polish: Uzbrój się, jak tylko możesz. Chyba że nie masz... nic? Bo nie znalazłeś swojej zgubionej spluwy? Jeśli tak, to po prostu idź na śmierć.
links.belarusian: Узброіся, як толькі можаш. Хіба што ў цябе няма... нічога? Бо не знайшоў сваёй згубленай пушкі? Калі так, то проста ідзі на смерць.

links.title: Rhetoric: "I can talk you out of it, whatever..."
links.english: I can talk you out of it, whatever it is.
links.polish: Cokolwiek się stanie, pomogę ci się z tego wykręcić.
links.belarusian: Што б ні здарылася, я дапамагу табе выбрацца з гэтага.

links.title: Suggestion: "You're too likable to die. Don't wo..."
links.english: You're too likable to die. Don't worry.
links.polish: Jesteś zbyt sympatyczny, żeby umrzeć. Bez obaw.
links.belarusian: Вы занадта сімпатычны, каб памерці. Без турбот.

links.title: You: "Time to party?"
links.english: Time to party?
links.polish: Czas na imprezę?
links.belarusian: Час для вечарынкі?

links.title: Inland Empire: "Time for grim, serious, deadly, dan..."
links.english: Time for grim, serious, deadly, dangerous. It's not going to be fun.
links.polish: Czas na to, co ponure, poważne, śmiercionośne, niebezpieczne. Nie będzie miło.
links.belarusian: Час на тое, што панурае, сур'ёзнае, смяротна небяспечнае. Не будзе прыемна.

links.title: You: "Time for the tribunal?"
links.english: Time for the tribunal?
links.polish: Czas na trybunał?
links.belarusian: Час на трыбунал?

links.title: Inland Empire: "Yes. And it's not going to be fun."
links.english: Yes. And it's not going to be fun.
links.polish: Tak. I nie będzie tam przyjemnie.
links.belarusian: Так. І не будзе там прыемна.

links.title: You: "Sounds ominous."
links.english: Sounds ominous.
links.polish: Brzmi złowrogo.
links.belarusian: Гучыць злавесна.

links.title: Inland Empire: "It is."
links.english: It is.
links.polish: I takie też jest.
links.belarusian: І такое таксама ёсць.

links.title: You: "[Discard thought.]"
links.english: [Discard thought.]
links.polish: [Odrzuć myśl].
links.belarusian: [Адкінь думку].

links.title: Inland Empire: "No, no. You cannot get off that eas..."
links.english: No, no. You cannot get off that easy. This is serious. Lives are at stake.
links.polish: Nie, nie. Nie możesz się z tego tak łatwo wymigać. To jest poważna sprawa. W grę wchodzi ludzkie życie.
links.belarusian: Не, не. Ты не можаш так лёгка ад гэтага ўхіліцца. Гэта сур'ёзная справа. На коне чалавечае жыццё.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Yours included."
links.english: Yours included.
links.polish: Również twoje.
links.belarusian: Таксама тваё.
